description: After-action reports documenting incident outcomes, timelines, lessons learned, and improvement actions for completed incidents.

records.seo_reportTitle: After-Action Report: County Road 15 Brush Fire
records.seo_incidentSummary: 2.5-acre brush fire along County Road 15. Two engine companies responded with mutual aid from Metro Fire initially declined (not needed). Fire contained within 2.5 hours using defensive perimeter strategy. No structures damaged. No injuries.
records.seo_timelineOfEvents:
13:55 - 911 call received from hiker
14:00 - E11 and brush crew dispatched
14:15 - E11 on scene, fire estimated 1 acre
14:20 - Brush crew on scene, defensive perimeter established
15:00 - Fire growth stopped at 2 acres
16:30 - Fire under control, 2.5 acres total
17:45 - Brush crew cleared
18:00 - E11 cleared, scene released
records.seo_lessonsLearned:
1. Early dispatch of brush-type apparatus was effective for wildland terrain.
2. Wind shift at 15:00 nearly outflanked containment line — need earlier weather monitoring.
3. Radio communications on TAC channel were clear throughout.
records.seo_improvementActions:
1. Implement automatic weather alerts for wildland incidents.
2. Update pre-plan for County Road corridor with access point map.
3. Schedule brush clearing along road shoulders before fire season.

records.seo_reportTitle: After-Action Report: Park Ave Medical Emergency
records.seo_incidentSummary: Single-patient cardiac emergency. ALS response with STEMI identification and rapid transport to Metro General Hospital. Patient transferred to cardiac catheterization lab within 45 minutes of 911 call.
records.seo_lessonsLearned: STEMI protocol worked as designed. Door-to-cath-lab time under target.
